item.title: 阿波罗在被视为受保护的资产支持贷款中蒙受100%损失
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司因亚马逊品牌聚合平台Perch的资产支持融资项目全盘告吹，蒙受约1.7亿美元损失。这一策略曾被誉为私募信贷领域最安全、最具前景的投资方式，此次遭遇的挫折实属罕见。【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. took a roughly $170 million hit after an asset-backed financing for Amazon brand aggregator Perch was wiped out, a rare stumble for a strategy touted as one of private credit’s safest and most promising.】

item.title: 詹妮弗·加纳零食公司力图摆脱好莱坞IPO魔咒
item.description: 若Once Upon a Farm PBC公司首次公开募股表现亮眼，首场谢幕时站在舞台中央的应是首席执行官约翰·福雷克，而非女演员詹妮弗·加纳。【原文：If Once Upon a Farm PBC performs well in its debut as a public company, the first curtain call should feature Chief Executive Officer John Foraker at center stage, not only actress Jennifer Garner.】

item.title: 倍耐力中国投资者提出计划以解决美国方面的担忧
item.description: 倍耐力集团最大股东中国中化集团提交了一份提案，旨在解决这家意大利轮胎制造商的治理问题及潜在的美国监管担忧。【原文：Pirelli & C. SpA’s biggest investor, China’s Sinochem Group, submitted a proposal aimed at addressing the Italian tiremaker’s governance and potential US regulatory concerns.】

item.title: 石油巨头在哈萨克斯坦油田纠纷中损失高达40亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在哈萨克斯坦运营卡拉恰甘纳克油田的国际石油巨头在一桩国际仲裁案中败诉，需向该国政府支付高达40亿美元的赔偿金。【原文：The oil majors that operate the Karachaganak field in Kazakhstan lost an international arbitration case, leaving them liable to pay as much as $4 billion in compensation to the country’s government, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 贝克休斯将数据中心订单目标翻倍至30亿美元，以满足人工智能的电力需求
item.description: 贝克休斯公司作为全球最大的油田承包商之一，宣布计划在三年内将数据中心设备订单目标翻倍至30亿美元，此举源于人工智能运行所需电力需求的激增。【原文：Baker Hughes Co., one of the world’s biggest oilfield contractors, said it plans to double its data center equipment order target to $3 billion over a three-year period, driven by surging demand for power to run artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 甲骨文公司因当地反对意见上调数据中心就业预测
item.description: 甲骨文公司预测，其在新墨西哥州为OpenAI建造的大型数据中心将创造比先前宣布更多的就业岗位，这再次体现了科技公司试图宣传服务器农场积极影响的努力。【原文：Oracle Corp. predicted that a massive data center it’s developing for OpenAI in New Mexico will create more jobs than previously announced, another example of tech companies trying promote positive impacts of server farms.】

item.title: 全球与国内秩序的瓦解
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读本期通讯，这里汇集了Odd Lots世界每日精选内容。有时是我们——乔·韦森塔尔和特蕾西·阿洛威——为您解读市场、金融与经济领域的最新动态；有时则是来自我们专家嘉宾及信息源网络的深度贡献。无论内容形式如何，我们承诺始终为您带来精彩内容。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 乌拉圭将基准利率降至6.5%，关注比索汇率与通胀目标
item.description: 乌拉圭央行将基准利率下调整整1个百分点至6.5%，因本国货币波动威胁其通胀目标。【原文：Uruguay’s central bank slashed its benchmark interest rate by a full percentage point to 6.5% as a volatility in the local currency threatens its inflation target.】

item.title: 津巴布韦通胀率自1997年以来首次跌破两位数
item.description: 津巴布韦年度通胀率自1997年以来首次降至个位数，当局称这一进展对该国在2030年前采用黄金支撑的津巴布韦元（ZiG）作为唯一货币至关重要。【原文：Zimbabwe’s annual inflation rate fell to single digits for the first time since 1997, a development authorities say is essential to adopting the gold-backed ZiG as the country’s sole currency by 2030.】

item.title: CSG创纪录的IPO为欧洲防务类股票上市复苏奠定基础
item.description: 随着CSG NV的股价高于其在阿姆斯特丹的首次公开发行价，欧洲后续的上市活动或将助力将这一势头转化为该地区股权资本市场的复苏。【原文：With CSG NV shares trading higher than its Amsterdam initial public offering price, the next listings in Europe may help turn that momentum into a revival for the continent’s equity capital markets.】

item.title: 克罗地亚总理提名阿利·科里奇出任新任财政部长
item.description: 克罗地亚总理安德烈·普连科维奇提名央行副行长托米斯拉夫·科里奇接任财政部长一职。【原文：Croatian Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic nominated Tomislav Coric, a central bank vice governor, to take over as finance minister.】

item.title: 育碧计划裁员近200人 总部进行重组
item.description: 育碧娱乐公司已就裁减法国总部多达200个岗位展开磋商，此举是这家《刺客信条》开发商重组计划的一部分。【原文：Ubisoft Entertainment SA has entered discussions to cut as many as 200 jobs at its French headquarters as part of a reorganization of the Assassin’s Creed maker.】

item.title: 内塔尼亚胡顾问呼吁评级机构上调以色列评级
item.description: 以色列总理本雅明·内塔尼亚胡的首席经济顾问阿维·西姆洪表示，以色列的信用评级应予上调，以反映其与哈马斯达成的十月停火协议，尤其考虑到债券市场已对战后局势作出调整。【原文：Israel’s credit ratings should be upgraded to reflect the October ceasefire with Hamas, particularly as bond markets have already adjusted to a post-war scenario, according to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s top economic adviser, Avi Simhon.】

item.title: 加密货币错失宏观交易良机，散户纷纷涌入黄金与股票市场
item.description: 黄金价格突破5000美元大关。股市持续飙升。美元再度走弱。然而被誉为动能交易与"贬值避险"双重选择的比特币却在观望。其价格停滞不前，交易量萎靡不振，长期投资者正转向股票和贵金属等更可靠的市场。【原文：Gold is topping $5,000. Stocks keep booming. The dollar is falling again. Yet Bitcoin — hailed as both a momentum and “debasement” trade — is sitting out the action. Its price is stalling, volumes are limp, and longtime believers are drifting toward more dependable markets like equities and precious metals.】

item.title: 并购套利者迎来交易窗口期，生物科技领域成首选目标
item.description: 并购套利投资者——刚刚经历并购交易的繁荣之年——预计这一趋势不会减弱，生物技术公司被视为第一季度潜在收购目标中的领头羊。【原文：Merger arbitrage investors — fresh off a boom year for dealmaking — expect no let-up in the trend, with biotechnology firms seen as leading the pack among potential takeover candidates in the first quarter.】

item.title: 意大利宣布进入紧急状态，风暴损失超15亿欧元
item.description: 意大利政府宣布进入紧急状态，并拨出1亿欧元资金用于修复南部部分地区遭受海啸袭击后的破坏。【原文：Italy’s government declared a state of emergency, unlocking €100 million in funds to help repair damage after a sea storm battered parts of the country’s south.】

item.title: 巴西前财政部长称，下一任巴西领导人需要明确的债务计划
item.description: 巴西前财政部长曼苏埃托·阿尔梅达表示，巴西下届政府需要迅速推出可信的财政计划以稳定公共债务，否则将面临动摇金融市场的风险。【原文：Brazil’s next government will need to move quickly to present a credible fiscal plan to stabilize public debt, or risk unsettling financial markets, according to former Treasury Secretary Mansueto Almeida.】

item.title: 桥水对债券持谨慎态度，因政府支出和人工智能引发的通胀风险加剧
item.description: 对冲基金桥水公司认为，鉴于各国政府扩大公共开支带来的风险以及人工智能的通胀影响，股票比债券更具吸引力。【原文：Hedge fund Bridgewater Associates favors stocks over bonds given the risks posed by governments ramping up public spending and the inflationary impact of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 美国国债价格上涨，欧洲债券市场领涨，因即将举行拍卖
item.description: 美国国债价格上涨，因欧洲多数政府债券市场的涨幅抵消了强劲的美国经济数据及本周提前启动的拍卖带来的供应压力。【原文：Treasuries rose as gains in most European government bond markets offset strong US economic data and supply pressure from this week’s early-starting auctions.】

item.title: 贝莱德私募债务基金因减记贷款价值暴跌
item.description: 贝莱德旗下私募债务基金暴跌，创近六年最大跌幅。此前该基金披露其在系列问题投资中计提减值准备，并免除部分管理费。【原文：A BlackRock Inc. private debt fund plunged the most in almost six years after it disclosed writedowns across a series of troubled investments and waived some of its fee.】

item.title: 约翰·艾尔沃德的对冲基金Sona计划在伦敦设立更大规模的办公室
item.description: 据知情人士透露，信贷交易专家约翰·艾尔沃德旗下的投资公司索纳资产管理正计划迁至伦敦皮卡迪利区更大的办公场所。【原文：Credit trading specialist John Aylward’s investment firm Sona Asset Management is planning to move to a bigger office in London’s Piccadilly neighborhood, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 微软推出最新AI芯片以减少对英伟达的依赖
item.description: 微软公司正推出其第二代人工智能芯片，该芯片是该公司推动服务更高效运行、并为英伟达公司硬件提供替代方案的核心产品。【原文：Microsoft Corp. is rolling out its second-generation artificial intelligence chip, the centerpiece of the company’s push to power its services more efficiently and provide an alternative to Nvidia Corp. hardware.】

item.title: 化工企业雅高瑞玛筹备债务展期谈判
item.description: 特种化学品生产商雅高瑞正准备就延长债务期限展开谈判，此前该行业经历低迷期后，其业绩正逐步好转。【原文：Specialty chemicals producer Archroma is readying for talks over an extension to its debt stack, as its results are improving following a period of weakness in its industry.】

item.title: 特立尼达和多巴哥财政部长宣布10亿美元债券发售
item.description: 特立尼达和多巴哥在美完成10亿美元债券发售，该加勒比国家财政部长表示将动用能源项目收益及税制改革所得偿还债务。【原文：Trinidad and Tobago completed a $1 billion bond sale in the US market, with the Caribbean nation’s finance chief signaling he’ll use revenue from energy projects and tax reform to repay the debt.】

item.title: 美国财政部称已取消与博思艾伦公司的合同
item.description: 美国财政部表示，在咨询公司博思艾伦汉密尔顿未能保护其接触到的纳税人数据（包括唐纳德·特朗普总统的纳税申报表）后，已取消与该公司价值2100万美元的合同。【原文：The US Treasury Department said it canceled $21 million of contracts with Booz Allen Hamilton after the consulting firm failed to protect taxpayer data to which it had access, including President Donald Trump’s tax returns.】

item.title: 苏格兰启动银行遴选程序 主导首次债券发售
item.description: 苏格兰政府已着手物色银行和律师事务所，为其首次债券发售提供服务。执政党计划在五月大选后若继续执政，将推进这项计划。【原文：The Scottish government started a search for banks and lawyers to run its debut bond sales, which the ruling party plans to pursue if it remains in power following elections in May.】

item.title: 苹果发布新款AirTag，具备更远探测距离和更响亮扬声器
item.description: 苹果公司发布了升级版AirTag配件，这款售价29美元的物品追踪器现具备更远的探测距离、更响亮的扬声器及其他改进功能。【原文：Apple Inc. unveiled an upgraded AirTag accessory, with the $29 item finder now offering longer range, a louder speaker and other improvements.】

item.title: 美股上涨，交易员将目光投向华盛顿新风险之外
item.description: 周一早盘，美国股市高开，交易员们权衡了新的贸易和政策风险，以及强劲的第四季度财报开局。【原文：US stocks opened higher Monday morning as traders weighed a combination of fresh trade and policy risks against a strong start to fourth-quarter earnings.】

item.title: 两名非洲债务国退出困境国家俱乐部，仅剩塞内加尔
item.description: 在莫桑比克和加蓬的债务收益率相对美国国债收窄后，塞内加尔成为非洲唯一主权风险溢价仍处于困境区域的国家。【原文：Senegal has been left as the only African nation with a sovereign risk premium in distressed territory after yields on the debt of Mozambique and Gabon narrowed relative to US Treasuries.】

item.title: 塞内加尔与摩洛哥签署协议以加强两国关系，此前两国因足球事件产生分歧
item.description: 塞内加尔正努力加强与主要贸易伙伴摩洛哥的关系，此前非洲顶级足球赛事中一场争议性比赛给两国历来密切的双边关系蒙上阴影。【原文：Senegal is striving to bolster ties with key trading partner Morocco, after a contentious match at Africa’s top football event cast a shadow over their historically close relationship.】
